result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin D McDougal

records.addlTxt:
10:27 AM Defendant Justin D McDougal appeared by phone.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Justin D McDougal.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Atty Gumz waives time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on November 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:23 AM Defendant Justin D McDougal appeared by phone.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions the defendant regarding counsel.  Defendant did not contact the Public Defender office but wants to call them. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will give the defendant one more chance to contact the PD office.
bond continued
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
of No Contact Provision of Bond
*No contact with Victim 1 or their residence  *Defendant is allowed to go to residence one time with Law Enforcement with prior notice to the victim, to get his belongings.

3:38 PM Defendant Justin D McDougal appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address and phone. 
Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and is going to contact the PD office.

Atty Juech has no objection to a signature bond with conditions. 

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*No contact with Victim 1 or their residence
*Defendant is allowed to go to residence one time with Law Enforcement with prior notice to the victim, to get his belongings.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
